resources.string: Seems like the donation app wasn\'t purchased through Play Store! If you pirated it, then shame on you!

This feature is only available when the donation app is installed! Don\'t worry though. Because this app is open source you can easily build it yourself and remove this check. But I hope you support developers anyway. Thanks for using Kernel Adiutor! Once you bought the donation app you have to restart Kernel Adiutor in order to enable all features.
I won\'t fall for this scam!
I love this app. Must donate!
Permission denied for writing to storage!
Please select a file with %s extension.
Set the maximum frequency the CPU scales up to.
Set the minimum frequency the CPU scales down to.
Set the maximum frequency the CPU scales up to when the screen is off.
The CPU governor determines how the CPU behaves in response to changes in workload. Changing the governor will impact how the CPU scales through the frequency steps available to your CPU.
The various configuration items which are Governor-dependent.

Failed to read current governor of CPU.\n\nIf you are using a QCOM big.LITTLE device this is a known problem. The system forces the CPU to turn off cores making it extremely hard to read out CPU specific stats. Try to select this option again. The CPU sometimes refuses to turn on a core.
Try to group tasks into the least cores possible.
Schedule workqueues on awake CPUs to save power.
Policy decides the CFS scheduler how to balance tasks onto different CPU unit.
CPUQuiet implements pluggable policies for forcing cpu cores into quiescent state. Appropriate policies will save power without hurting performance.
Allows you to activate debug mask for operations.
Minimum interval a CPU is boosted.
When CPU loading crosses the preset threshold, the current CPU is raised to this frequency.
Minimum interval a CPU is boosted when input is detected.
CPU frequency to be boosted to this frequency upon input detection.
Wakeup Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when screen is turned on.
Hotplug Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when CPUs go online.
This will boost your minimum CPU speed if you touch the screen or press a button.
Disable to remove manufacturer limits on undervolting
More than one hotplugging system is enabled!\nPlease only use one.
Qualcomm\'s hotplugging solution. You might get problems with changing frequencies when this is enabled.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by faux123.
The number in the parentheses indicates the amount of cores online at any time.
The lower it is, the faster response.
The higher, the less CPUs are used.
Maximum number of CPUs boosted at the same time.
Minimum number of CPUs that will be always online.
Maximum number of CPUs that will be always online.
Maximum number of CPUs that will be online when the screen is off.
Minimum interval a CPU is boosted.
Minimum interval a CPU is kept online.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Code_Blue team.
Sets 1 CPU maximum online with frequency @1728MHz.
Over this threshold the driver will put one more core online.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by myfluxi.
Number of samples taken in consideration for average load across CPUs. Lower means quicker/more erratic.
Interval between taking samples of load across CPUs. Lower means quicker/more erratic.
Improve latencies by instantly putting online all CPUs if current load on any CPU is above a certain threshold.
Sets the minimum frequency the CPU scales down to when fast lane reaches the above load.
Don\'t offline a CPU if it drops under the lower levels up threshold load.
Used to make the hotplug consider the I/O time as CPU load time.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by franciscofranco.
Number of CPUs online when touching screen or pressing button.
The threshold to online all CPUs.
The threshold to online all CPUs.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by show-p1984.
Use only one CPU when screen is off.
If the first core is below this frequency, then don\'t plug the other cores.
How long the CPU should be boosted after touching the screen.
Time until Hotplug starts to work.
If something else plugs in the CPU, fall asleep for this amount of time.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Alucard.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s hotplugging. Developed by varunchitre15.
Minimum number of CPUs that will be online when the screen is off.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by bbedward.
How long to wait before turning on any CPUs.
Don\'t turn on any cores when charge is below the selected capacity.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by mrg666.
Cycles to wait after the last hotplug event to unplug another core.
Cycles to wait after the last hotplug event to plug another core.
Qualcomm\'s hotplugging solution. Sorry you can\'t turn it off. #blameqcom
Threshold when big CPUs should be turned off.
Threshold when big CPUs should be turned on.
Time before turning off a CPU.
Use only one thermal driver from the following options, using more at the same time may cause unexpected behavior.
Stock thermal driver that prevents device from overheating. This should be disabled if current kernel has an alternative.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by faux123.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by faux123 and alucard_24.
Allows you to activate debug mask for thermal operations.
Temperature to start shutting down CPUs.
If the temperature goes above, the thermal will throttle the CPU frequency to lower the temperature.
This allows to debug the CPUs throttle when the temperature reaches maximum.
The thermal will use this frequency to throttle the maximum temperature.
Set the maximum 2D frequency the GPU scales up to.
Set the maximum frequency the GPU scales up to.
Set the minimum frequency the GPU scales down to.
Set the 2D governor of the GPU.
Set the governor of the GPU.
An add-on for MSM Adreno TZ GPU Governor. Developed by faux123.
This increases the threshold to ramp up or down GPU frequencies. The lower it is, the more performance you get.
This increases the number of times the GPU governor ramp down requests. The higher it is, the more performance you get.
An efficient workaround for msm-adreno-tz\'s overheads. Developed by arter97.
Threshold for determining if the given workload is idle.

Number of events to wait before ramping down the frequency. The idlewait\'th events before current one must be all idle before Adreno idler ramps down the frequency. This implementation is to prevent micro-lags on scrolling or playing games. Adreno idler will more actively try to ramp down the frequency if this is set to a lower value.
Adreno idler will more actively try to ramp down the frequency if this is set to a higher value.
You might get problems with MSM8x26 SoC when setting a high value.
After selecting a profile, please turn your screen off and on.
Use exponential backlight mode instead of linear mode.
Allows you to decrease the LCD screen brightness lower than it\'s possible on stock.
Allows you to increase the LCD screen brightness higher than it\'s possible on stock.
Enable inverting the screen colors by quickly pressing MENU button 4 times.

Register intercept acts like a hook and will enable catching scenario settings and modifying them through delta controls. If a scenario does not have a setting (register) in its base sequence, then it cannot be modified by the hook.
Enabling the master sequence will disable and ignore Samsung\'s profiles and scenarios, the ROM controls will be disabled.
Enabling this will let you use your phone even while wearing gloves.
Wake up your device by double tapping the screen.
Wake up your device by swiping on the screen.
Only require 1st and 4th button to trigger Sweep2Wake.
Wake up your device by tapping the screen.
Lock your device by double tapping on the top of the screen.
Lock you device by swiping on the screen.
Launch default camera by drawing a circle on the screen.
Enabling this will turn off wake controls when the device is in a pocket.
Set a duration when the wake controls will be disabled after the screen goes off.
Enabling this will turn off wake controls when the screen is turned off by the power key.
Device will charge faster when connected with USB. Replug your charger when changing this option.
Set a limit for the capacity to which the battery will be charged by passing a value between 0 and 100.
Set charging current. Caution: Exceeding 1250mA may damage your charging driver.
Enable for fading, disable for blinking.
Set the active I/O elevator algorithm. The Scheduler decides how to handle I/O requests.
The various configuration items which are Scheduler-dependent.
The Read-ahead value on the phone memory.
Reduces memory usage but has an impact on the CPU usage.
Reduces some CPU usage in return for less memory savings.
Make LMK more aggressive dynamically when a thrashing scenario is detected.
Kill LMK when swap is in use.
How full swap needs to be to kill LMK.

Attempts to increase performance by avoiding paging on physical storage, instead using a compressed virtual device in RAM. Paging takes place in RAM until it is necessary to use the swap space on physical storage.
CRC is a mechanism aiming to prevent data corruption when enabled. Data blocks can lose up to 30% of their performance.
Disable for better file system performance at the risk of data loss in case of a system crash.
When enabled and screen is on, fsync operation is asynchronous. When screen is off, this operation is done synchronously.
Only give sleepers 50% of their service deficit. Disabling this can save a little battery power.
Kernel Mode, LCD Hooks and Highest Level Hook are automatically managed by the kernel. To manually enable or disable the Power Suspend State choose User Mode.
Kernel power management driver when screen is off. Better battery savings if enabled. Note: You can only change this setting if Power Suspend Mode is in User Mode.
The Transmission Control Protocol is one of the core protocols of the Internet protocol suite (IP), and is so common that the entire suite is often called TCP/IP.
Prevent wakelock when Ambient Display disabled.
In this section you can create or import custom controls, which don\'t exist in the app (yet).
Whether the switch is enabled. Return 1 for enabled and 0 for disabled.
The switch will return either 1 (enabled) or 0 (disabled) as argument to your shell script.
Current state of the seekbar. By defining min and max an integer array gets created. For example: Min is 50 and Max is 100 and progress is 0, that would mean 50 is the current state of the seekbar.
Seekbar will return its current progress. For example your Min is 50 and Max 100 and the seekbar is at 70, it will return 20 as progress.
Current value of the editor. Can be basically anything.
Editor will return whatever was entered.
Version of import file is too old!
Couldn\'t find any supported kernels! Please check your internet access.

The downloaded file has a different MD5. This has following reasons:

• The downloaded file is corrupted
• The developer has declared a wrong MD5

Try to download the file again. If you still get this error, please contact the developer of this kernel.
In profiles mode your changes won\'t have an impact on apply on boot.
Everything you change here is gonna be saved to your profile. But attention! Your settings will also get applied, but won\'t get saved to apply on boot.
You have to add actions first!
Do you want to run your actions? Your device will reboot into recovery and the actions will run in the order as you added them.
If you want to apply a profile at a specific event, such as launching an application, you have to use Tasker.
Show toast when tasker applies a profile
Show a tile which allows you to select a profile.
No profile found! You have to create them first.
All sections disabled! No profiles for you.
If your device doesn\'t support Init.d by default, you can enable this to emulate its behaviour.

Hi, I\'m Willi Ye aka Grarak, a 19 year old student living in Vienna. I\'ve been developing on Android for quite a long time. Beside Kernel Adiutor I\'m also maintaining CyanogenMod for few devices and working on ParanoidAndroid. So please understand if I don\'t find the time to update this application.
Adiutor is Latin and means helper.
Do I have to donate in order to use those premium features?
No, this application is open source. You can easily build it yourself. Donation features are enabled by default once you build a debugging apk, so no need to change any line of code.
Why doesn\'t my determined CPU freq stick?

This could be due to many reasons. Many kernels nowadays have their own hotplugging system which controls the CPU frequency and CyanogenMod has their own CPU Boost implementation which regulate the frequency. I would suggest you don\'t touch the CPU frequencies and let the kernel do its job. This also counts for other functions! If they don\'t stick, it\'s because the kernel/system doesn\'t want to let you change it.
Why don\'t features x and y show up?
Only features which are supported by your device are shown!
If you don\'t know what this control does, then simply don\'t touch it. Please do a proper research before playing with your expensive hardware.
Could you add feature x and y?
That\'s hard to say. I try to add all features, but it\'s hard to make this app universal for all devices.
Test apply on boot. This includes all kind of things which are getting applied during booting, such as custom controls, profiles, init.d, etc.

You can protect Kernel Adiutor by setting up a password. Every time you open this application, you have to enter it. If you forget it, simply wipe the data of this application in settings of your device. Don\'t worry I won\'t share your password.
Use fingerprint to pass security check. This will work as long you have fingerprints registered.
Restart the app when you changed the visibility of sections below.
